description: The adversary is trying to communicate with compromised systems to control them. Command and Control consists of techniques that adversaries may use to communicate with systems under their control within a victim network. Adversaries commonly attempt to mimic normal, expected traffic to avoid detection. There are many ways an adversary can establish command and control with various levels of stealth depending on the victimâ€™s network structure and defenses.
name: OSRS Combined MITRE ATT&CK Matrix - Command and Control
source: MITRE ATT&CK Matrices Windows, Linux, AWS, GCP, Azure, and SaaS

values.description: Adversaries may communicate over a commonly used port to bypass firewalls or network detection systems and to blend with normal network activity to avoid more detailed inspection.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1043 Commonly Used Port

values.description: Adversaries may use an existing, legitimate external Web service as a means for relaying commands to a compromised system.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1102 Web Service

values.description: Adversaries may use an existing, legitimate external Web service as a means for relaying commands to a compromised system.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1102 Web Service

values.description: Adversaries may conduct C2 communications over a non-standard port to bypass proxies and firewalls that have been improperly configured.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1065 Uncommonly Used Port

values.description: Adversaries may conduct C2 communications over a non-standard port to bypass proxies and firewalls that have been improperly configured.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1065 Uncommonly Used Port

values.description: Use of a standard non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network. The list of possible protocols is extensive. Specific examples include use of network layer protocols, such as the Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), transport layer protocols, such as the User Datagram Protocol (UDP), session layer protocols, such as Socket Secure (SOCKS), as well as redirected and (or) tunneled protocols, such as Serial over LAN (SOL).
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1095 Standard Non-Application Layer Protocol

values.description: Use of a standard non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network. The list of possible protocols is extensive. Specific examples include use of network layer protocols, such as the Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), transport layer protocols, such as the User Datagram Protocol (UDP), session layer protocols, such as Socket Secure (SOCKS), as well as redirected and (or) tunneled protocols, such as Serial over LAN (SOL).
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1095 Standard Non-Application Layer Protocol

values.description: Adversaries may explicitly employ a known encryption algorithm to conceal command and control traffic rather than relying on any inherent protections provided by a communication protocol. Despite the use of a secure algorithm, these implementations may be vulnerable to reverse engineering if necessary secret keys are encoded and (or) generated within malware samples and (or) configuration files.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1032 Standard Cryptographic Protocol

values.description: Adversaries may explicitly employ a known encryption algorithm to conceal command and control traffic rather than relying on any inherent protections provided by a communication protocol. Despite the use of a secure algorithm, these implementations may be vulnerable to reverse engineering if necessary secret keys are encoded and (or) generated within malware samples and (or) configuration files.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1032 Standard Cryptographic Protocol

values.description: Adversaries may communicate using a common, standardized application layer protocol such as HTTP, HTTPS, SMTP, or DNS to avoid detection by blending in with existing traffic. Commands to the remote system, and often the results of those commands, will be embedded within the protocol traffic between the client and server.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1071 Standard Application Layer Protocol

values.description: Adversaries may communicate using a common, standardized application layer protocol such as HTTP, HTTPS, SMTP, or DNS to avoid detection by blending in with existing traffic. Commands to the remote system, and often the results of those commands, will be embedded within the protocol traffic between the client and server.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1071 Standard Application Layer Protocol

values.description: Files may be copied from one system to another to stage adversary tools or other files over the course of an operation. Files may be copied from an external adversary-controlled system through the Command and Control channel to bring tools into the victim network or through alternate protocols with another tool such as FTP. Files can also be copied over on Mac and Linux with native tools like scp, rsync, and sftp.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1105 Remote File Copy

values.description: Files may be copied from one system to another to stage adversary tools or other files over the course of an operation. Files may be copied from an external adversary-controlled system through the Command and Control channel to bring tools into the victim network or through alternate protocols with another tool such as FTP. Files can also be copied over on Mac and Linux with native tools like scp, rsync, and sftp.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1105 Remote File Copy

values.description: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks. These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be whitelisted within a target environment. Remote access tools like VNC, Ammy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1219 Remote Access Tools

values.description: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks. These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be whitelisted within a target environment. Remote access tools like VNC, Ammy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1219 Remote Access Tools

values.description: An adversary performs C2 communications using multiple layers of encryption, typically (but not exclusively) tunneling a custom encryption scheme within a protocol encryption scheme such as HTTPS or SMTPS.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1079 Multilayer Encryption

values.description: An adversary performs C2 communications using multiple layers of encryption, typically (but not exclusively) tunneling a custom encryption scheme within a protocol encryption scheme such as HTTPS or SMTPS.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1079 Multilayer Encryption

values.description: Some adversaries may split communications between different protocols. There could be one protocol for inbound command and control and another for outbound data, allowing it to bypass certain firewall restrictions. The split could also be random to simply avoid data threshold alerts on any one communication.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1026 Multiband Communication

values.description: Some adversaries may split communications between different protocols. There could be one protocol for inbound command and control and another for outbound data, allowing it to bypass certain firewall restrictions. The split could also be random to simply avoid data threshold alerts on any one communication.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1026 Multiband Communication

values.description: Adversaries may create multiple stages for command and control that are employed under different conditions or for certain functions. Use of multiple stages may obfuscate the command and control channel to make detection more difficult.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1104 Multi-Stage Channels

values.description: Adversaries may create multiple stages for command and control that are employed under different conditions or for certain functions. Use of multiple stages may obfuscate the command and control channel to make detection more difficult.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1104 Multi-Stage Channels

values.description: To disguise the source of malicious traffic, adversaries may chain together multiple proxies. Typically, a defender will be able to identify the last proxy traffic traversed before it enters their network; the defender may or may not be able to identify any previous proxies before the last-hop proxy. This technique makes identifying the original source of the malicious traffic even more difficult by requiring the defender to trace malicious traffic through several proxies to identify its source.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1188 Multi-hop Proxy

values.description: To disguise the source of malicious traffic, adversaries may chain together multiple proxies. Typically, a defender will be able to identify the last proxy traffic traversed before it enters their network; the defender may or may not be able to identify any previous proxies before the last-hop proxy. This technique makes identifying the original source of the malicious traffic even more difficult by requiring the defender to trace malicious traffic through several proxies to identify its source.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1188 Multi-hop Proxy

values.description: Adversaries may use fallback or alternate communication channels if the primary channel is compromised or inaccessible in order to maintain reliable command and control and to avoid data transfer thresholds.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1008 Fallback Channels

values.description: Adversaries may use fallback or alternate communication channels if the primary channel is compromised or inaccessible in order to maintain reliable command and control and to avoid data transfer thresholds.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1008 Fallback Channels

values.description: Adversaries may make use of Domain Generation Algorithms (DGAs) to dynamically identify a destination for command and control traffic rather than relying on a list of static IP addresses or domains. This has the advantage of making it much harder for defenders block, track, or take over the command and control channel, as there potentially could be thousands of domains that malware can check for instructions.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1483 Domain Generation Algorithms

values.description: Adversaries may make use of Domain Generation Algorithms (DGAs) to dynamically identify a destination for command and control traffic rather than relying on a list of static IP addresses or domains. This has the advantage of making it much harder for defenders block, track, or take over the command and control channel, as there potentially could be thousands of domains that malware can check for instructions.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1483 Domain Generation Algorithms

values.description: Domain fronting takes advantage of routing schemes in Content Delivery Networks (CDNs) and other services which host multiple domains to obfuscate the intended destination of HTTPS traffic or traffic tunneled through HTTPS. The technique involves using different domain names in the SNI field of the TLS header and the Host field of the HTTP header. If both domains are served from the same CDN, then the CDN may route to the address specified in the HTTP header after unwrapping the TLS header. A variation of the the technique, domainless fronting, utilizes a SNI field that is left blank; this may allow the fronting to work even when the CDN attempts to validate that the SNI and HTTP Host fields match (if the blank SNI fields are ignored).
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1172 Domain Fronting

values.description: Domain fronting takes advantage of routing schemes in Content Delivery Networks (CDNs) and other services which host multiple domains to obfuscate the intended destination of HTTPS traffic or traffic tunneled through HTTPS. The technique involves using different domain names in the SNI field of the TLS header and the Host field of the HTTP header. If both domains are served from the same CDN, then the CDN may route to the address specified in the HTTP header after unwrapping the TLS header. A variation of the the technique, domainless fronting, utilizes a SNI field that is left blank; this may allow the fronting to work even when the CDN attempts to validate that the SNI and HTTP Host fields match (if the blank SNI fields are ignored).
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1172 Domain Fronting

values.description: Command and control (C2) communications are hidden (but not necessarily encrypted) in an attempt to make the content more difficult to discover or decipher and to make the communication less conspicuous and hide commands from being seen. This encompasses many methods, such as adding junk data to protocol traffic, using steganography, commingling legitimate traffic with C2 communications traffic, or using a non-standard data encoding system, such as a modified Base64 encoding for the message body of an HTTP request.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1001 Data Obfuscation

values.description: Command and control (C2) communications are hidden (but not necessarily encrypted) in an attempt to make the content more difficult to discover or decipher and to make the communication less conspicuous and hide commands from being seen. This encompasses many methods, such as adding junk data to protocol traffic, using steganography, commingling legitimate traffic with C2 communications traffic, or using a non-standard data encoding system, such as a modified Base64 encoding for the message body of an HTTP request.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1001 Data Obfuscation

values.description: Command and control (C2) information is encoded using a standard data encoding system. Use of data encoding may be to adhere to existing protocol specifications and includes use of ASCII, Unicode, Base64, MIME, UTF-8, or other binary-to-text and character encoding systems. Some data encoding systems may also result in data compression, such as gzip.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1132 Data Encoding

values.description: Command and control (C2) information is encoded using a standard data encoding system. Use of data encoding may be to adhere to existing protocol specifications and includes use of ASCII, Unicode, Base64, MIME, UTF-8, or other binary-to-text and character encoding systems. Some data encoding systems may also result in data compression, such as gzip.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1132 Data Encoding

values.description: Adversaries may use a custom cryptographic protocol or algorithm to hide command and control traffic. A simple scheme, such as XOR-ing the plaintext with a fixed key, will produce a very weak ciphertext.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1024 Custom Cryptographic Protocol

values.description: Adversaries may use a custom cryptographic protocol or algorithm to hide command and control traffic. A simple scheme, such as XOR-ing the plaintext with a fixed key, will produce a very weak ciphertext.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1024 Custom Cryptographic Protocol

values.description: Adversaries may communicate using a custom command and control protocol instead of encapsulating commands and (or) data in an existing Standard Application Layer Protocol. Implementations include mimicking well-known protocols or developing custom protocols (including raw sockets) on top of fundamental protocols provided by TCP,IP, or another standard network stack.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1094 Custom Command and Control Protocol

values.description: Adversaries may communicate using a custom command and control protocol instead of encapsulating commands and (or) data in an existing Standard Application Layer Protocol. Implementations include mimicking well-known protocols or developing custom protocols (including raw sockets) on top of fundamental protocols provided by TCP,IP, or another standard network stack.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1094 Custom Command and Control Protocol

values.description: Adversaries may use a connection proxy to direct network traffic between systems or act as an intermediary for network communications to a command and control server to avoid direct connections to their infrastructure. Many tools exist that enable traffic redirection through proxies or port redirection, including HTRAN, ZXProxy, and ZXPortMap. Adversaries use these types of proxies to manage command and control communications, to reduce the number of simultaneous outbound network connections, to provide resiliency in the face of connection loss, or to ride over existing trusted communications paths between victims to avoid suspicion.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1090 Connection Proxy

values.description: Adversaries may use a connection proxy to direct network traffic between systems or act as an intermediary for network communications to a command and control server to avoid direct connections to their infrastructure. Many tools exist that enable traffic redirection through proxies or port redirection, including HTRAN, ZXProxy, and ZXPortMap. Adversaries use these types of proxies to manage command and control communications, to reduce the number of simultaneous outbound network connections, to provide resiliency in the face of connection loss, or to ride over existing trusted communications paths between victims to avoid suspicion.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1090 Connection Proxy

values.description: Adversaries can perform command and control between compromised hosts on potentially disconnected networks using removable media to transfer commands from system to system. Both systems would need to be compromised, with the likelihood that an Internet-connected system was compromised first and the second through lateral movement by Replication Through Removable Media. Commands and files would be relayed from the disconnected system to the Internet-connected system to which the adversary has direct access.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Windows T1092 Communication Through Removable Media

values.description: Adversaries can perform command and control between compromised hosts on potentially disconnected networks using removable media to transfer commands from system to system. Both systems would need to be compromised, with the likelihood that an Internet-connected system was compromised first and the second through lateral movement by Replication Through Removable Media. Commands and files would be relayed from the disconnected system to the Internet-connected system to which the adversary has direct access.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1092 Communication Through Removable Media

values.description: Port Knocking is a well-established method used by both defenders and adversaries to hide open ports from access. To enable a port, an adversary sends a series of packets with certain characteristics before the port will be opened. Usually this series of packets consists of attempted connections to a predefined sequence of closed ports, but can involve unusual flags, specific strings or other unique characteristics. After the sequence is completed, opening a port is often accomplished by the host based firewall, but could also be implemented by custom software.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1205 Port Knocking

values.description: Adversaries may communicate over a commonly used port to bypass firewalls or network detection systems and to blend with normal network activity to avoid more detailed inspection.
values.value: OSRS Combined MITRE ATK Command and Control: Linux T1043 Commonly Used Port
